snippet.textDisplay:
Translation from Italian to English (rough):
Awaken! Reach out your hand. The time has come.
Awaken! The doors shall hatch open. Awaken! Awaken! Awaken! The time has come.
Come on, remember, you're anxious. Come on, wake up! Hey, remember!
Awaken! Reach out your hand. The time has come.
And one more time, the doors will open.
Come on, remember, you're anxious. Come on, wake up! Hey, remember!
Eh? What? You do not want it? Nevertheless it belongs to you. What you have lost shall become one.
snippet.textOriginal:
Translation from Italian to English (rough):
Awaken! Reach out your hand. The time has come.
Awaken! The doors shall hatch open. Awaken! Awaken! Awaken! The time has come.
Come on, remember, you're anxious. Come on, wake up! Hey, remember!
Awaken! Reach out your hand. The time has come.
And one more time, the doors will open.
Come on, remember, you're anxious. Come on, wake up! Hey, remember!
Eh? What? You do not want it? Nevertheless it belongs to you. What you have lost shall become one.

snippet.textDisplay: I remember my aunt showed me Kingdom when i was about 5 or 6, she said "This game is REALLY good, you should try it!" I said "Disney? i doubt it's that good, i mean, Donald Duck killing monsters? meh" Later in that year, i gave Kingdom Hearts a try. after a while playing the game for a few hours, my aunt came by and asked "So what do you think of it now?" I replied "This is the best game, ever!" Kingdom Hearts changed my life.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember my aunt showed me Kingdom when i was about 5 or 6, she said "This game is REALLY good, you should try it!" I said "Disney? i doubt it's that good, i mean, Donald Duck killing monsters? meh" Later in that year, i gave Kingdom Hearts a try. after a while playing the game for a few hours, my aunt came by and asked "So what do you think of it now?" I replied "This is the best game, ever!" Kingdom Hearts changed my life.

snippet.textDisplay:
@herofromthedark I wouldn't go that far. Specially if you've seen Advent Children, where Cloud and Sephiroth very similar things.
When I posted that comment I was referring to FF characters in the KH universe(Tetsuya Nomura FF characters). FFVI can actually claim going to the end of the world and in fact taking it a step further.I'm just laying claim that they're total badasses(the other characters in the game just watched! C'mon Cloud...), not that they're the only ones to have done it.

snippet.textDisplay: @daytimesky I never used any magic other than healing in the first game, so that wasn't much of change. The first game was mostly linear too so the second game didn't bother me much. I agree, the first game is more challenging, but that's hardly a big issue. However I do feel KH2 was a much more diverse game, and a lot tighter gameplay wise. And it's one of the few examples where QTEs are used in clever and interesting ways. KH2 butchered Ariel and Hollow Bastion, though...
snippet.textOriginal: @daytimesky I never used any magic other than healing in the first game, so that wasn't much of change. The first game was mostly linear too so the second game didn't bother me much. I agree, the first game is more challenging, but that's hardly a big issue. However I do feel KH2 was a much more diverse game, and a lot tighter gameplay wise. And it's one of the few examples where QTEs are used in clever and interesting ways. KH2 butchered Ariel and Hollow Bastion, though...

snippet.textDisplay: @daytimesky Ah really? I love the second game so much more. I like the characters more, they've grown up and they're much less whiny. The worlds are even better and have some of my favourite disney lands (POTC? Lion King? Hell yeah). The game is much longer. You're just lying with 'fewer secrets' because the game is packed with them (100+ hours, 97%...sigh). I adore the battle system, its much more active. I do agree that it's easier, but they make up for it by having a ton of enemies on screen
snippet.textOriginal: @daytimesky Ah really? I love the second game so much more. I like the characters more, they've grown up and they're much less whiny. The worlds are even better and have some of my favourite disney lands (POTC? Lion King? Hell yeah). The game is much longer. You're just lying with 'fewer secrets' because the game is packed with them (100+ hours, 97%...sigh). I adore the battle system, its much more active. I do agree that it's easier, but they make up for it by having a ton of enemies on screen

snippet.textDisplay: @Smarty4789 Strongly disagree. The second game is VERY linear in its level design with very few secrets to look for, magic has become a joke (there's no reason to use any spell other than healing), and with a lot of the attack abilities you gain, it soon reaches the point where only the boss fights are tough, even on the higher difficulty. To me, the second game was a colossal disappointment.
snippet.textOriginal: @Smarty4789 Strongly disagree. The second game is VERY linear in its level design with very few secrets to look for, magic has become a joke (there's no reason to use any spell other than healing), and with a lot of the attack abilities you gain, it soon reaches the point where only the boss fights are tough, even on the higher difficulty. To me, the second game was a colossal disappointment.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Personally, I think BBS is great. Although you don't have teammates alongside you, it feels a lot like the first game to me in terms of level design (as long as you're not playing as Terra, who visits linear versions of the worlds!!), and I find it a lot of fun. As long as I'm not playing as Terra.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Personally, I think BBS is great. Although you don't have teammates alongside you, it feels a lot like the first game to me in terms of level design (as long as you're not playing as Terra, who visits linear versions of the worlds!!), and I find it a lot of fun. As long as I'm not playing as Terra.

snippet.textDisplay: @0MakoBlaster0 Well, yeah. It's kind of a better game too.
snippet.textOriginal: @0MakoBlaster0 Well, yeah. It's kind of a better game too.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Arc13 I should add to that, the story I don't find terrible, but it's ridiculous to claim it to be ultra deep, when the creators themselves have claimed it be a story of light vs dark, nothing more.
On a side note, is it odd this sounds epic side by side with a silent Nyancat?
snippet.textOriginal:
@Arc13 I should add to that, the story I don't find terrible, but it's ridiculous to claim it to be ultra deep, when the creators themselves have claimed it be a story of light vs dark, nothing more.
On a side note, is it odd this sounds epic side by side with a silent Nyancat?

snippet.textDisplay: @Sickopath333 Yeah. I still don't understand a friend of mine, convinced not only is it the greatest game ever, but it's because of it's story. He also from his explanation has made it seem much deeper than what it is. He believes they're actually referencing people as nobodies and heartless, and it plays into how racist society is at those that don't understand others. Can't seem to grasp the concept it's just light VS dark with a bunch of blah blah blah WTF in it.
snippet.textOriginal: @Sickopath333 Yeah. I still don't understand a friend of mine, convinced not only is it the greatest game ever, but it's because of it's story. He also from his explanation has made it seem much deeper than what it is. He believes they're actually referencing people as nobodies and heartless, and it plays into how racist society is at those that don't understand others. Can't seem to grasp the concept it's just light VS dark with a bunch of blah blah blah WTF in it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well I'm about to start playing Kingdom Hearts BBS on the PSP. It's been a while since I played Kingdom Hearts II which I really liked, so I'm looking forward to getting back into this series. It's also an excuse to dust off my PSP which has been sitting there for about a year.

Destati is a classic to me, it's a theme I immediately recognize. I'm a fan of the music in this series and the bipolar atmosphere which is sometimes light and other times dark.
snippet.textOriginal:
Well I'm about to start playing Kingdom Hearts BBS on the PSP. It's been a while since I played Kingdom Hearts II which I really liked, so I'm looking forward to getting back into this series. It's also an excuse to dust off my PSP which has been sitting there for about a year.

Destati is a classic to me, it's a theme I immediately recognize. I'm a fan of the music in this series and the bipolar atmosphere which is sometimes light and other times dark.
